update.description:
Allows the user to place a model v3, v4, or v5 robot with Sandia, Robotiq, or iRobot hands into any of the vrc_final or drc_practice worlds using the model_args and hand_suffix arguments. hand_suffix determines which bringup.launch file is launched, and the model_args argument is passed to that launchfile.

Note: iRobot hands will probably not load unless [this branch](#!/osrf/drcsim/pull-request/495/fix-installation-location-of-irobot-hands/diff) is used
update.title: Added model_args and hand_suffix arguments to all vrc_final and drc_practice launchfiles

content.raw:
I've tabled the issue by making the default hand_suffix for all of the tasks "_sandia_hands".

However, this command won't work (trying to launch atlas without any hands):

```
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo vrc_final_task1.launch model_args:="_v4" hand_suffix:=""
```

Steve has made issue #452 for this problem. Think it should get solved in this pull request, or at a later date?
content.html:
I've tabled the issue by making the default hand_suffix for all of the tasks "_sandia_hands".

However, this command won't work (trying to launch atlas without any hands):

roslaunch drcsim_gazebo vrc_final_task1.launch model_args:="_v4" hand_suffix:=""

Steve has made issue #452 for this problem. Think it should get solved in this pull request, or at a later date?

content.raw:
just checking - this is not supposed to work right?

~~~
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo vrc_final_task1.launch model_args:="_v4"
~~~

it gives the msg:

~~~
unused args [model_args] for include of [/home/ian/depot/catkin_ws2/install/share/drcsim_gazebo/launch/atlas_bringup.launch]
~~~

but this works:

~~~
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo vrc_final_task1.launch model_args:="_v4" hand_suffix:="_sandia_hands"
~~~
content.html:
just checking - this is not supposed to work right?

roslaunch drcsim_gazebo vrc_final_task1.launch model_args:="_v4"

it gives the msg:

unused args [model_args] for include of [/home/ian/depot/catkin_ws2/install/share/drcsim_gazebo/launch/atlas_bringup.launch]

but this works:

roslaunch drcsim_gazebo vrc_final_task1.launch model_args:="_v4" hand_suffix:="_sandia_hands"

update.description:
Allows the user to place a model v3, v4, or v5 robot with Sandia, Robotiq, or iRobot hands into any of the vrc_final or drc_practice worlds using the model_args and hand_suffix arguments. hand_suffix determines which bringup.launch file is launched, and the model_args argument is passed to that launchfile.

Gazebo has trouble finding the STLs for the iRobot hands when I run it. Thought we fixed this?
update.title: Added model_args and hand_suffix arguments to all vrc_final and drc_practice launchfiles

pull_request.title: Added model_args and hand_suffix arguments to all vrc_final and drc_practice launchfiles

update.description:
Allows the user to place a model v3, v4, or v5 robot with Sandia, Robotiq, or iRobot hands into any of the vrc_final or drc_practice worlds using the model_args and hand_suffix arguments.

Some notes about hands:

Gazebo has trouble finding the STLs for the iRobot hands when I run it. Thought we fixed this?

~~The robotiq hands are not supported using the hand_suffix args because they do not support a model_args parameter. You can still insert Atlas with robotiq hands if you set model_args:="_robotiq_hands".~~ right now the bringup file is chosen by choosing the bringup launchfile that matches "model_args". Smarter solutions for choosing which bringup file to use are welcome.
update.title: Added model_args and hand_suffix arguments to all vrc_final and drc_practice launchfiles

Gazebo has trouble finding the STLs for the iRobot hands when I run it. Thought we fixed this?

~~The robotiq hands are not supported using the hand_suffix args because they do not support a model_args parameter. You can still insert Atlas with robotiq hands if you set model_args:="_robotiq_hands".~~ right now the bringup file is chosen by choosing the bringup launchfile that matches "model_args". Smarter solutions for choosing which bringup file to use are welcome.

update.description:
Allows the user to place a model v3, v4, or v5 robot with Sandia or iRobot hands into any of the vrc_final or drc_practice worlds using the model_args and hand_suffix arguments.

Some notes about hands:

Gazebo has trouble finding the STLs for the iRobot hands when I run it. Thought we fixed this?

~~The robotiq hands are not supported using the hand_suffix args because they do not support a model_args parameter. You can still insert Atlas with robotiq hands if you set model_args:="_robotiq_hands".~~ right now the bringup file is chosen by choosing the bringup launchfile that matches "model_args". pull_request.title: Added model_args and hand_suffix arguments to all vrc_final and drc_practice launchfiles

update.description:
Allows the user to place a model v3, v4, or v5 robot with Sandia or iRobot hands into any of the vrc_final or drc_practice worlds using the model_args and hand_suffix arguments.

Some notes about hands:

Gazebo has trouble finding the STLs for the iRobot hands when I run it. Thought we fixed this?

The robotiq hands are not supported using the hand_suffix args because they do not support a model_args parameter. You can still insert Atlas with robotiq hands if you set model_args:="_robotiq_hands".
update.title: Added model_args and hand_suffix arguments to all vrc_final and drc_practice launchfhiles

update.description:
Allows the user to place a model v3, v4, or v5 robot with Sandia or iRobot hands into any of the vrc_final or drc_practice worlds using the model_args and hand_suffix arguments.

Some notes about hands:

Gazebo has trouble finding the STLs for the iRobot hands when I run it. Thought we fixed this?

The robotiq hands are not supported using the hand_suffix args because they do not support a model_args parameter. You can still insert Atlas with robotiq hands if you set model_args:="_robotiq_hands".
